name: nuclear fuel factory construction | nuclear fuel factory | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2778/documentation

Data on the construction of a UO2 (no MOX mixed oxides, no RepU reprocessed fuel, and no HEU highly enriched uranium from warheads) fuel fabrication facility are pretty old and representing reference plants form US Studies on total material & energy use in energy chains. It is roughly assumed that 100% of concrete with reinforcing bars are dumped in an depository for inerts. Data for same dataset GLO used herewith for China, with only differences for electricity mix and some transport distances for materials (transport distance for enriched UF6 same as for GLO). This dataset has been developed with the goal to serve a preliminary estimation of the Chinese nuclear chain for the Chinese electricity mix. Hence, it cannot be used for comparisons of fuel fabrication infrastrucure among countries.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



The module includes: land use of the factory; energy (electricity and diesel) and material requirements for the construction of the facility; transport requirements during construction; energy and transport requirements (for non-contaminated inerts concrete with reinforcing bars) during decommissioning; disposal of the non-contaminated inerts. The non contaminated metals are assumed to be recycled.
category: F:Construction/41:Construction of buildings/410:Construction of buildings/4100:Construction of buildings

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: North American and European conditions adapted to China
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Information regards facilities operating in the 1980s.
